artist: Artist: Katsushika Hokusai; Publisher: Tsuruya Kiemon
catalogue_raissonne: Ukiyo-e shūka 16 (1981), p. 227, vertical chūban #25.3; RSK00902
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription: Written on the lantern: namu amida butsu (praying words), zokumyō Iwa-jo (the name of the woman who became a ghost)
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From One Hundred Tales (Hyaku monogatari 百物語)
signed: Saki no Hokusai hitsu 前北斎筆
text: Ghost tale of Iwa is a famous story based on the real event, known as "Yotsuya Kaidan (Ghost Tale in Yotsuya)", later had been made a Kabuki play by Tsuruya Nanboku. An unemployed samurai, Iemon married Iwa, a daughter of a warrior family looking for a man who can succeed their family name. After the marriage, he poisoned and killed his wife, and was haunted by the ghost of his wife.
title: The Ghost of Oiwa
